meanings.definition: To spend time aimlessly or idly.
meanings.sent1: She was putzing around the house, not doing anything productive.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys putzing in the garden on lazy Sunday afternoons.
meanings.sent3: Instead of studying, she was putzing with her phone, scrolling mindlessly.
meanings.sent4: The cat putzing with a ball of yarn reminded me of how carefree life can be.
meanings.sent5: The sound of waves putzing against the shore was soothing and calming.

meanings.definition: To tinker or fiddle with something.
meanings.sent1: He was putzing with the broken radio, trying to fix it.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys putzing with old watches, trying to make them work again.
meanings.sent3: The kids were putzing with the toy car, trying to figure out how it worked.
meanings.sent4: His fingers were putzing with the lock, trying to open it quietly.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was putzing under the hood, examining the engine carefully.

meanings.sent1: Instead of working on the project, he was putzing around on social media.
meanings.sent2: She knew she was putzing when she rearranged her desk for the third time.
meanings.sent3: The students were putzing in the library instead of studying for their exams.
meanings.sent4: Time was putzing away as he continued to delay making an important decision.
meanings.sent5: Procrastination was putzing with his plans, delaying his progress.
